snippet: F.B.I. agents investigating the Boston Marathon bombing have repeatedly questioned a former separatist fighter who says he had a passing social relationship with a bombing suspect.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation agents investigating Boston Marathon bombing have repeatedly questioned Musa Khadzhimuratov, Chechen refugee and former separatist fighter who says he had a passing social relationship with slain bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow. William K. Rashbaum and Richard A. Oppel Jr. contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: F.B.I. agents investigating the Boston Marathon bombing have repeatedly questioned a former separatist fighter who says he had a passing social relationship with a bombing suspect.

headline.main: Chechen Refugee Questioned in F.B.I.’s Inquiry of Bombing
headline.print_headline: Chechen Refugee Questioned In F.B.I.’s Inquiry of Bombing
